com.innowhere.jnieasy.core.mem
Interface NativeBuffer

All Superinterfaces:
NativeAddress
public interface NativeBuffer
extends NativeAddress

The interface NativeBuffer is implemented by the framework to encapsulate a native memory block.

When an instance is garbage collected, the native memory is freed automatically if the buffer owns the native memory.

Use with care if this object is got from a native instance, it may interfere with the normal life cycle of the related native instance.

The sizes used to read and write the native memory are the Java sizes of the primitive types ever: boolean=1, byte=1, char=2, short=2, int=4, long=8, float=4, double=8. They are not affected by methods like NativeTypeManager.setDefaultBooleanSize(long) with two exceptions:

  1. Ansi Strings are defined with 1 byte native chars
  2. Unicode Strings are defined with 2 bytes per native char in Win32 and 4 bytes in Linux/Mac/Solaris (the size of wchar_t in these platforms). If 4 bytes used the upper 2 bytes of the wchar_t are lost because the Java char size is 2 bytes (this is not a problem because most of Unicode fits into 2 bytes) The wchar_t size is not fixed and can be changed with the method NativeTypeManager.setWCharTSize(long)

NativeBuffer's methods are not multithread safe.

Author:
Jose M. Arranz Santamaria
See Also:
NativeManager.allocateBuffer(long), NativeManager.attachBuffer(long), NativeManager.attachBuffer(long,long), NativeStateManager.getBuffer()

Methods inherited from interface com.innowhere.jnieasy.core.mem.NativeAddress
getOffset, getParentAddress, getValue
 

Method Detail

free

void free()
Frees the associated native memory if buffer owns it, else does nothing.

Current implementation calls free(boolean) with force set to false.

free

void free(boolean force)
Frees the associated native memory.

If force is true native memory is freed ever, else is freed if buffer owns it, else does nothing.

If native memory is freed this buffer can not be used anymore.

Parameters:
force - if true native memory is freed ever, if false is freed if buffer owns the memory.

disconnect

void disconnect()
Disconnects this buffer of the owned native memory, if buffer does not own the native memory does nothing.

When this buffer is garbage collected native memory is not freed.

The buffer remains attached and may be used after to invoke this method.

isAttached

boolean isAttached()
Returns true if buffer does not own the associated native memory.

When this buffer is garbage collected native memory is not freed.

Returns:
true if attached not owning the native memory.

isAttachedTo

boolean isAttachedTo(NativeAddress address,
                     long offset)
Returns true if buffer is attached to the specified parent address and offset.

Parent address and offset must be coincident.

If buffer owns the native memory returns false.

Parameters:
address - the parent address.
offset - the relative offset to parent address.
Returns:
true if buffer is attached to parent address and offset.

size

long size()
Returns the native memory size of the buffer or -1 if unknown.

If the size is unknown the buffer does not impose a superior limit.

Returns:
the native memory size or -1.

getBoolean

boolean getBoolean(long offset)
Returns a boolean read from the native memory in the buffer address + the specified offset.

If accessed memory is out of bounds, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
offset - the relative address offset.
Returns:
the data read from native memory.

                boolean value)
Updates with a boolean data the native memory in the buffer address + the specified offset.

If accessed memory is out of bounds, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
offset - the relative address offset.
value - the new value to write.

getAddress

long getAddress(long offset)
Returns a platform address value read from the native memory in the buffer address + the specified offset.

In a 32 bit platform an int value is read, in a 64 bit will be a long value read.

If accessed memory is out of bounds, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
offset - the relative address offset.
Returns:
the data read from native memory.

setAddress

void setAddress(long offset,
                long value)
Updates with a platform address data the native memory in the buffer address + the specified offset.

In a 32 bit platform an int value is written, in a 64 bit will be a long value written.

If accessed memory is out of bounds, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
offset - the relative address offset.
value - the new value to write.

getAnsiString

java.lang.String getAnsiString(long offset)
Returns a java.lang.String read from the native memory in the buffer address + the specified offset until a '\0' character is found, converting each byte (C char) read to a Java char.

The '\0' finalizer is not assigned to the String.

If accessed memory is out of bounds, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
offset - the relative address offset.
Returns:
the ANSI String read from native memory.

setAnsiString

void setAnsiString(long offset,
                   java.lang.String value)
Writes on the native memory the specified java.lang.String in the buffer address + the specified offset, each character is converted to one byte (C char), the '\0' character is written in the end.

If accessed memory is out of bounds, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
offset - the relative address offset.
value - the new ANSI string to write.

getUnicodeString

java.lang.String getUnicodeString(long offset)
Returns a java.lang.String read from the native memory in the buffer address + the specified offset until a C L'\0' character is found converting each 2 byte (Win32 wchar_t) or 4 byte (Linux/Mac/Solaris wchar_t) read to a Java char.

The '\0' finalizer is not assigned to the String.

If accessed memory is out of bounds, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
offset - the relative address offset.
Returns:
the UNICODE String read from native memory.
See Also:
NativeTypeManager.setWCharTSize(long)

setUnicodeString

void setUnicodeString(long offset,
                      java.lang.String value)
Writes on the native memory the specified java.lang.String in the buffer address + the specified offset, each character is converted to two bytes (C wchar_t), the C L'\0' character is written in the end.

If accessed memory is out of bounds, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
offset - the relative address offset.
value - the new UNICODE string to write.
See Also:
NativeTypeManager.setWCharTSize(long)

getAnsiStringBuffer

java.lang.StringBuffer getAnsiStringBuffer(long offset)
Returns a java.lang.StringBuffer read from the native memory in the buffer address + the specified offset until a '\0' character is found, converting each byte (C char) read to a Java char.

Current implementation reads a String with getAnsiString(long) and copies it to a new StringBuffer.

If accessed memory is out of bounds, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
offset - the relative address offset.
Returns:
the ANSI StringBuffer read from native memory.

setAnsiStringBuffer

void setAnsiStringBuffer(long offset,
                         java.lang.StringBuffer value)
Writes on the native memory the specified java.lang.StringBuffer in the buffer address + the specified offset, each character is converted to one byte (C char), the '\0' character is written in the end.

Current implementation gets a String from the StringBuffer and writes to native memory with setAnsiString(long,String).

If accessed memory is out of bounds, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
offset - the relative address offset.
value - the new ANSI string to write.

getUnicodeStringBuffer

java.lang.StringBuffer getUnicodeStringBuffer(long offset)
Returns a java.lang.StringBuffer read from the native memory in the buffer address + the specified offset until a '\0' character is found, converting each byte (C char) read to a Java char.

Current implementation reads a String with getUnicodeString(long) and copies it to a new StringBuffer.

If accessed memory is out of bounds, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
offset - the relative address offset.
Returns:
the ANSI StringBuffer read from native memory.

setUnicodeStringBuffer

void setUnicodeStringBuffer(long offset,
                            java.lang.StringBuffer value)
Writes on the native memory the specified java.lang.StringBuffer in the buffer address + the specified offset, each character is converted to two bytes (C wchar_t), the C L'\0' character is written in the end.

Current implementation gets a String from the StringBuffer and writes to native memory with setUnicodeString(long,String).

If accessed memory is out of bounds, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
offset - the relative address offset.
value - the new UNICODE string to write.
See Also:
NativeTypeManager.setWCharTSize(long)

getAnsiStringLength

int getAnsiStringLength(long offset)
Returns the length of the '\0' ended string from the native memory in the buffer address + the specified offset. Each byte is counted as a character.

If accessed memory is out of bounds, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
offset - the relative address offset.
Returns:
the ANSI string length.

getUnicodeStringLength

int getUnicodeStringLength(long offset)
Returns the length of the L'\0' (wide char) ended string from the native memory in the buffer address + the specified offset. Each 2 bytes (Win32 wchar_t) or 4 bytes (Linux/Mac/Solaris wchar_t) are counted as a character.

If accessed memory is out of bounds, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
offset - the relative address offset.
Returns:
the UNICODE string length.
See Also:
NativeTypeManager.setWCharTSize(long)

getBooleanArray

boolean[] getBooleanArray(long offset,
                          boolean[] buf,
                          int index,
                          int length)
Returns a boolean array read from the native memory in the buffer address + the specified offset.

If accessed memory is out of bounds, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
offset - the specified offset.
buf - the array to copy read data. Can not be null.
index - the starting index of buf to copy.
length - the number of elements to be copied.
Returns:
the data array read from native memory, the buf parameter.

setBooleanArray

void setBooleanArray(long offset,
                     boolean[] buf,
                     int index,
                     int length)
Updates with a boolean data array the native memory in the buffer address + the specified offset.

If accessed memory is out of bounds, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
offset - the specified offset.
buf - the source array to write data in native memory. Can not be null.
index - the starting index of buf to write.
length - the number of elements to be written.

                    long[] buf,
                    int index,
                    int length)
Returns a long array read from the native memory in the buffer address + the specified offset.

If accessed memory is out of bounds, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
offset - the specified offset.
buf - the array to copy read data. Can not be null.
index - the starting index of buf to copy.
length - the number of elements to be copied.
Returns:
the data array read from native memory, the buf parameter.

setLongArray

void setLongArray(long offset,
                  long[] buf,
                  int index,
                  int length)
Updates with a long data array the native memory in the buffer address + the specified offset.

If accessed memory is out of bounds, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
offset - the specified offset.
buf - the source array to write data in native memory. Can not be null.
index - the starting index of buf to write.
length - the number of elements to be written.

getBooleanArray

boolean getBooleanArray(long offset,
                        int index)
Returns a boolean array element read from the native memory in the buffer address + the specified offset with the specified index.

Final address is calculated as (Java boolean size is 1 byte):

buffer address + offset + index * 1

If accessed memory is out of bounds, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
offset - the specified offset, where the array starts.
index - the element array index.
Returns:
the data read from native memory.

setBooleanArray

void setBooleanArray(long offset,
                     int index,
                     boolean value)
Updates a boolean array element on the native memory in the buffer address + the specified offset with the specified index.

Final address is calculated as (Java boolean size is 1 byte):

buffer address + offset + index * 1

If accessed memory is out of bounds, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
offset - the specified offset, where the array starts.
index - the element array index.
value - the new value.

getBuffer

NativeBuffer getBuffer(long offset,
                       long size)
Returns a new native buffer mapping a native memory part of the buffer.

The returned buffer is ever attached to the native memory (does not own the memory) and is independent of parent buffer (native memory shared is the only one dependency).

If accessed memory is out of bounds, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
offset - the specified offset.
size - the size of the native memory.
Returns:
a new buffer mapping a memory part.

setBuffer

void setBuffer(long offset,
               NativeBuffer value)

newBufferIterator

NativeBufferIterator newBufferIterator()
Creates a new native buffer iterator of this buffer.

Returns:
the new iterator.
